Act5Scene3.speaker: Macbeth
Act5Scene3.text: Bring me no more reports. Let them fly all. Till Birnam Wood remove to Dunsinane I cannot taint with fear.
Act5Scene3.translation: Don't bring me more reports. Let the thanes run from me. Until Birnam Wood moves, I won't be affected by fear.

Act5Scene3.speaker: Macbeth
Act5Scene3.text: What’s the boy Malcolm? Was he not born of woman? The spirits that know all mortal consequences have pronounced me thus:

Act5Scene3.speaker: Macbeth
Act5Scene3.text: 'Fear not, Macbeth. No man that’s born of woman Shall e’er have power upon thee.'

Act5Scene3.speaker: Macbeth
Act5Scene3.text: Where got’st thou that goose-look?
Act5Scene3.translation: Why do look as frightened as a goose?

Act5Scene3.speaker: Servant
Act5Scene3.text: There is ten thousand soldiers, sir.

Act5Scene3.speaker: Macbeth
Act5Scene3.text: What soldiers, patch? Those linen cheeks of thine Are counselors to fear. What soldiers, whey-face?

Act5Scene3.speaker: Servant
Act5Scene3.text: The English force, so please you.

Act5Scene3.speaker: Macbeth
Act5Scene3.text: Take thy face hence.

Act5Scene3.speaker: Macbeth
Act5Scene3.text: Seyton!—I am sick at heart when I behold—Seyton, I say!—This push Will cheer me ever or disseat me now.

Act5Scene3.speaker: Macbeth
Act5Scene3.text: I have lived long enough. Seyton!

Act5Scene3.speaker: Seyton
Act5Scene3.text: What’s your gracious pleasure?

Act5Scene3.speaker: Macbeth
Act5Scene3.text: What news more?

Act5Scene3.speaker: Seyton
Act5Scene3.text: All is confirmed, my lord, which was reported. Give me my armor.

Act5Scene3.speaker: Seyton
Act5Scene3.text: ’Tis not needed yet.

Act5Scene3.speaker: Macbeth
Act5Scene3.text: I’ll put it on. Send out more horses. Skirr the country round. Hang those that talk of fear. Give me mine armor.

Act5Scene3.speaker: Macbeth
Act5Scene3.text: How does your patient, doctor?

Act5Scene3.speaker: Doctor
Act5Scene3.text: Not so sick, my lord, As she is troubled with thick-coming fancies That keep her from her rest.

Act5Scene3.speaker: Macbeth
Act5Scene3.text: Cure her of that. Canst thou not minister to a mind diseased?

Act5Scene3.speaker: Doctor
Act5Scene3.text: Therein the patient Must minister to himself.

Act5Scene3.speaker: Macbeth
Act5Scene3.text: Come, put mine armor on. Give me my staff. Seyton, send out. Bring it after me.

responses.text: I will not be afraid of death

Act5Scene3.speaker: Macbeth
Act5Scene3.text: I will not be afraid of death and bane Till Birnam Forest come to Dunsinane.
